Package Clock

Class Clock

java.lang.Object
Clock.Clock
public class Clock
extends java.lang.Object
Clock tracks the simulation time, by remembering its offset to the system time.

Implements Singleton Creational design pattern.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private java.util.Date date
    Date object to hold the current system's time.
    private static Clock instance
    creates an object of Clock, the singleton
    private long offset
    offset between the Clock time and the system time.
    private long period
    interval between Clock updating.
    private double prevSpeed
    Clock's previous speed value.
    private double speed
    Clock's speed relative to the system's.
    private java.util.Timer timer
    Timer object to schedule tick at a fixed rate.

    Modifier Constructor Description
    private Clock()
    private constructor to prevent instantiation.
    private Clock​(long p)
    private constructor to prevent instantiation.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void close()
    cancels the Timer's scheduled task to prevent the clock from updating.

    gets the current system time offset by the Clock's offset.

    private void updateTimer()

  • Field Details

    • instance

      private static Clock instance
      creates an object of Clock, the singleton

    • timer

      private java.util.Timer timer
      Timer object to schedule tick at a fixed rate.

    • date

      private java.util.Date date
      Date object to hold the current system's time. Unix Epoch.

    • offset

      private long offset
      offset between the Clock time and the system time.

    • period

      private long period
      interval between Clock updating.

    • speed

      private double speed
      Clock's speed relative to the system's.

    • prevSpeed

      private double prevSpeed
      Clock's previous speed value. Used to compensate speed during change in period.

  • Constructor Details

    • Clock

      private Clock()
      private constructor to prevent instantiation. defaults a period of 1 real second per clock second.

    • Clock

      private Clock​(long p)
      private constructor to prevent instantiation.
      Parameters:
      p - period at which the clock should update 1 second, in real milliseconds.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static Clock getInstance()
      returns the singleton instance. creates one if it doesn't exist.
      Returns:
      Clock singleton instance

    • tick

      private void tick()
      updates the Clock's time.

    • updateTimer

      private void updateTimer()
      Updates the timer's interval between tick to Clock advancing 1 second.

    • getClockTime

      public java.util.Date getClockTime()
      gets the current system time offset by the Clock's offset.
      Returns:
      Date of the Clock's time.

    • getClockEpochTime

      public long getClockEpochTime()
      gets the current system time offset by the Clock's offset.
      Returns:
      long of the Clock's time in Unix Epoch time.

    • setClockTime

      public void setClockTime​(java.util.Date d)
      sets the Clock's time. Internally calculates the offset between the given time and system time.
      Parameters:
      d - Date of the target time.

    • setPeriod

      public void setPeriod​(long p)
      Sets the period at which the clock will update 1 second. Also modifies the speed.
      Parameters:
      p - long, period in milliseconds.

    • setSpeed

      public void setSpeed​(double sp)
      Sets the speed at which the clock will update 1 second. Also modifies the period.
      Parameters:
      sp - double, number of clock seconds per real seconds.

    • close

      public void close()
      cancels the Timer's scheduled task to prevent the clock from updating.
